<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//======----------- WindowScheduler.cpp - window scheduler -------------======//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// An implementation of the Window Scheduling software pipelining algorithm.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The concept of the window algorithm was first unveiled in Steven Muchnick&#39;s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// book, &quot;Advanced Compiler Design And Implementation&quot;, and later elaborated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// upon in Venkatraman Govindaraju&#39;s report, &quot;Implementation of Software</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Pipelining Using Window Scheduling&quot;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The window algorithm can be perceived as a modulo scheduling algorithm with a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// stage count of 2 It boasts a higher scheduling success rate in targets with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// severe resource conflicts when compared to the classic Swing Modulo</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Scheduling (SMS) algorithm. To align with the LLVM scheduling framework, we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// have enhanced the original window algorithm. The primary steps are as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// follows:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1 Instead of duplicating the original MBB twice as mentioned in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// literature, we copy it three times, generating TripleMBB and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// corresponding TripleDAG.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2 We establish a scheduling window on TripleMBB and execute list scheduling</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// within it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 3 After multiple list scheduling, we select the best outcome and expand it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// into the final scheduling result.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To cater to the needs of various targets, we have developed the window</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// scheduler in a form that is easily derivable. We recommend employing this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// algorithm in targets with severe resource conflicts, and it can be utilized</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// either before or after the Register Allocator (RA).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The default implementation provided here is before RA. If it is to be used</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// after RA, certain critical algorithm functions will need to be derived.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;WINDOWSCHEDULER&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;WINDOWSCHEDULER&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineloopinfo-h">llvm/CodeGen/MachineLoopInfo.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineregisterinfo-h">llvm/CodeGen/MachineRegisterInfo.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinescheduler-h">llvm/CodeGen/MachineScheduler.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/scheduledaginstrs-h">llvm/CodeGen/ScheduleDAGInstrs.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetsubtargetinfo-h">llvm/CodeGen/TargetSubtargetInfo.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">namespace </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm">llvm</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13">WindowSchedulingFlag</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13a928a9fffc4999e7b94132985c714f0e1"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13a928a9fffc4999e7b94132985c714f0e1">WS&#95;Off</a>,  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Turn off window algorithm.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13ae768da8e96f8d52eebd6fa9e2cf40ad3"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13ae768da8e96f8d52eebd6fa9e2cf40ad3">WS&#95;On</a>,   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Use window algorithm after SMS algorithm fails.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13a14f36bdb57b5840e63c6fae657f025c5"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13a14f36bdb57b5840e63c6fae657f025c5">WS&#95;Force</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Use window algorithm instead of SMS algorithm.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The main class in the implementation of the target independent window</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// scheduler.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#af9bebcba4bcb359f1223392d9ff1e035">WindowScheduler</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a9301a41a35d6aa7367def5ea6fd78db7"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo">TargetRegisterInfo</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a9301a41a35d6aa7367def5ea6fd78db7">TRI</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a588faf8e1f126dc258d357b045595407"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineregisterinfo">MachineRegisterInfo</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a588faf8e1f126dc258d357b045595407">MRI</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// To innovatively identify the dependencies between MIs across two trips, we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// construct a DAG for a new MBB, which is created by copying the original</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// MBB three times. We refer to this new MBB as &#39;TripleMBB&#39; and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// corresponding DAG as &#39;TripleDAG&#39;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If the dependencies are more than two trips, we avoid applying window</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// algorithm by identifying successive phis in the old MBB.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#aabfa4ddad621932351b720f8162030e8"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;ScheduleDAGInstrs&gt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#aabfa4ddad621932351b720f8162030e8">TripleDAG</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// OriMIs keeps the MIs removed from the original MBB.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#aed4001b80ceaef38d700764e9934e054"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;MachineInstr &#42;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#aed4001b80ceaef38d700764e9934e054">OriMIs</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// TriMIs keeps the MIs of TripleMBB, which is used to restore TripleMBB.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#afbe266c442e9313e05ebffb703c2bd36"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;MachineInstr &#42;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#afbe266c442e9313e05ebffb703c2bd36">TriMIs</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// TriToOri keeps the mappings between the MI clones in TripleMBB and their</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// original MI.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a7e8c400b0b728b6ec230f0b487c6af44"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;MachineInstr &#42;, MachineInstr &#42;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a7e8c400b0b728b6ec230f0b487c6af44">TriToOri</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// OriToCycle keeps the mappings between the original MI and its issue cycle.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a54d52175d63bed9f3b0bd9f6317e023e"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;MachineInstr &#42;, int&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a54d52175d63bed9f3b0bd9f6317e023e">OriToCycle</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// SchedResult keeps the result of each list scheduling, and the format of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the tuple is &lt;MI pointer, Cycle, Stage, Order ID&gt;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#af3f7938e6818ec29f907451091b7fdad"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;std::tuple&lt;MachineInstr &#42;, int, int, int&gt;</a>, 256&gt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#af3f7938e6818ec29f907451091b7fdad">SchedResult</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// SchedPhiNum records the number of phi in the original MBB, and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// scheduling starts with MI after phis.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a1eade05b9c131318e2b1b8141cf3ef53"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a1eade05b9c131318e2b1b8141cf3ef53">SchedPhiNum</a> = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// SchedInstrNum records the MIs involved in scheduling in the original MBB,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// BestII and BestOffset record the characteristics of the best scheduling</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// result and are used together with SchedResult as the final window</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// scheduling result.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// BaseII is the II obtained when the window offset is SchedPhiNum. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// offset is the initial position of the sliding window.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#aaffbb1654d149fc4b75f0793c03cd398"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#aaffbb1654d149fc4b75f0793c03cd398">BaseII</a> = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"></CodeLine>
